meanings.sent1: After losing the race, he decided to repursue the championship next year.
meanings.sent2: She had to repursue her dream of becoming a doctor after facing obstacles.
meanings.sent3: The determined detective would repursue the suspect until justice was served.
meanings.sent4: Like a hunter after its prey, he would repursue his goals relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The idea of repursuing her passion filled her with renewed energy.

meanings.sent1: The dog would repursue the squirrel every time it entered the yard.
meanings.sent2: She had to repursue the runaway kite as it soared higher in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat would repursue the toy mouse around the room for hours.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a child again as he repursued his youth in the old photographs.
meanings.sent5: The athlete would repursue victory with unwavering determination.
